com.brogrammers.agora.data

Class CacheDataManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.brogrammers.agora.data.CacheDataManager

  • public class CacheDataManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A Cache Data Manager to push and pull question, answer, and comment objects to the device. This allows the device to retrieve these data objects while the device is offline. This class allows the user to: i. Store questions, answers and comments to be locally cached and viewed later (US 17) ii. Allow the user to view favourite questions/answers and their replies for view later (US 19) iii. Author questions, replies, and answers offline (US 20)
    Author:
    Group02

      • rememberQuestions

        public void rememberQuestions(java.util.List<Question> qList)
        Adds questions to the cache without saving them to file. Used for smoother loading of views.
        Parameters:
        qList - A list of questions to be cached

      • rememberQuestion

        public void rememberQuestion(Question q)
        Add a question to the cache without saving it to file. Used for smoother loading of views.
        Parameters:
        q - The question to be cached

      • pushAnswer

        public void pushAnswer(Answer a,
              java.lang.Long qID)
        Adds answer to an answer to a question in the cache
        Parameters:

        qID - the unique question id where the answer is added to

      • pushComment

        public void pushComment(Comment c,
               java.lang.Long qID,
               java.lang.Long aID)
        Allows you to add a comment to an answer or a question in the cache Passes in either a qID or an aID, and sets the other field to null to know where the comment goes
        Parameters:
        c - the comment object we are adding to the cache
        qID - the unique question id if we are commenting on the question, or null if commenting answer
        aID - the unique answer id if we are commenting the answer, or null if commenting question

      • clearCache

        public void clearCache()
        Clears both the in-memory cache of questions, as well as the on-disk cache of questions.
